channel.title: Virtual Memory, Buying RAM
channel.description:
i'd been planning on buying a RAM upgrade anyway, because when in ubuntu (i have a dual-boot w/ windows), i just installed compiz and that probably uses a lot of RAM. when in windows, which i pretty much just use for games, i sometimes have problems running a full-screen game (usually call of duty 1, which isn't all that graphics intensive imo) while running say iTunes and a messanging client or firefox. not too much to ask to be able to do this, right? usually, i will get a windows error about running low on virtual memory. is virtual memory related to graphics card, RAM, both, or something else? will getting more RAM help with this? if so, where should i buy it from? (i have gift certificates to bestbuy, and they sell it, but i haven't compared their prices with others yet). my system specs: dell dimension 2400 pentium 4 CPU 2.80 GHz 256 MB RAM
thanks in advance for help

item.title: Virtual Memory, Buying RAM
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

If he is not a gamer and more of a multi tasker, should still consider getting a new computer. Even with the spec’s i suggested. if you minus the video card you could get a Q6600 and 4gb ram. There you have your self an ultra fast multi tasker that will last you for many years to come. and have the ability to upgrade to a video card with the latest PCI-e 16x.

But if your just happy for a cheap upgrade, get what gikid suggested, but you cant keep upgrading something like that each time you need something. Im guessing its using PCI or AGP video card slot, if you decide to get a video card for gaming your limited to crap cards @ high prices. Or if you’d like to get 4gb memory your limited to crap ram at high prices. Same goes with processor.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 05, 2008, 09:03:50 AM[/size][hr]I was bored, and managed to make an average computer that will blow you’re current one away, and for a very tight budget.

https://secure.newegg.com/WishList/MySavedWishDetail.aspx?ID=8734406

198$. 188$ with rebate.

Cant get much better than that for the price, the inbuilt video card will be much better than your current one, so will everything else.

If you dont want to use you’re current case, you can spend 50$ on this http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811144041
that comes with a 420w power supply which is fine for that pc. Also 15$ if you want a dvd burner.

Read full topic

item.title: Virtual Memory, Buying RAM
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:17, topic:216931”]Man how the hell can u live on a peice of shit computer like that? i have 4 other computers that are all better than that, and they were just my previous ones… and no im not rich at all and i dont got a job etc.

Save up 300$ and come back, i can get u a medium computer that will run most things on high at a playable fps for about 300-400$ including 2-4 gigs of DDR2 ram.[/quote]

It seems like every post I’ve seen you make is to brag about your PC. Who cares, honestly. My favorite computer is my old Dell 2350. It’s perfect for gaming/general computing/surfing the net. You don’t need the best computer to do most of the tasks people use a computer for.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

i did some research, and i think it uses ddr, not ddr2. i think im gonna buy one of those packs of 2 separate 1 gb RAM units (units=right word?). i have another computer at a different house (also crappy, a dell dimension 4600, also uses ddr, that has 512 mb of ram and should be able to upgrade up to around 4 gb), so i think i will add 1 gb to each of these computers.

EDIT: this is gonna be way more expensive than what i was hoping for, i think i have about $100 total in gift certificates to best buy.
this should work for the 4600, its $64.99, still looking for something for the 2400

item.title: Virtual Memory, Buying RAM
item.dc:creator: @pk4pk pk4pk
item.description:
@pk4pk wrote:

256mb is fail. Anyways, graphics for games isn’t based on the RAM memory, it’s based on you graphic/video card. But RAM memory detormines the speed. Oh, and if you were to play online, your Internet would be another issue if your running dial up like NetZero, or AOL.

Read full topic
